name: Washington Marriott at Metro Center

reviews.text: Needed hotel near business meeting and wanted to be able to sightsee afterwards. I picked this on other TA reviews for proximity to Metro, which was right outside front doors and 2 quick stops to Union Station, as well as having museums and restaurants close. 6 pm check in, no lines, got room on 15 th floor. Strange though, concierge lounge was down on 2 nd floor. Room nice and clean, had requested a mini fridge, it was waiting when I got to room. Two of the glass cups in the room were stained. No real view just office buildings, halls were quiet never heard any of the neighbors. Bar crowded, they have good happy hour even on weekends. Concierge lounge seemed small for hotel of this size, standard fare in evenings but breakfast was good and attendant did good job keeping everything filled. Coffee was great. We received free continental breakfast on Saturday in restaurant since lounge is closed weekends. Most Marriott’s we stayed at let you enjoy the full buffet at no extra cost, but we were limited to the continental buffet which was fine, since its free.
reviews.title: Close to Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has security guards all over lobby, neighborhood is safe we walked around after 11pm both nights and never had a problem. Try Central Michel Richard restaurant, food was delicious. Smithsonian American Art Museum less than 2 blocks and they are open later than museums at the mall. This is a good downtown DC hotel, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Something was either really good or really bad. You be the judge.

reviews.text: I reserved the room while in town for a wedding. It was very clean, the staff was very friendly, and the restaurant and bar were accommodating. They have valet service, but I could park on the street that evening so I can't say anything about that. I would have given it 5 stars since the room was modestly priced for what you received and the location. The reason for 3 stars is as follows:
reviews.title: Location and service :-)

reviews.text: When I returned to my room Saturday evening, I decided to walk to the restaurant for a late night snack. I ordered 2 appetizers, quesadilla and hummus, for my girlfriend and I. The bill was $37 with tip. That's pretty high for what was ordered, but that is expected at a hotel. Anyway, I asked it to be sent to my room. The food never came, but it wasn't a big deal. It was late at night and you can't ask everything to be perfect. I called down and asked for the food again, but my girlfriend said she didn't feel like any hummus so we canceled that half. The quesadilla showed up shortly after.
reviews.title: worth repeating!

reviews.text: Upon checkout, I realized I was charged $15 for the quesadilla...but also the $37 for the original order that never came. No problem. I called the front desk and they removed the $37 from my bill. No hassle, BRAVO! When I finally left the room, I grabbed one of bottles of water on dresser for the road. As I cracked it open, my girlfriend belted out, "Don't drink that! They charge you for it!" I replied, "I know, but it is only like 2 or 3 dollars." I was wrong, it was $6 for a regular bottle of water. Well, shoot, they got me. Unfortunately, when checking my bill this morning, they charged me for 2 bottles rather than the one. I'm always fair with my reviews, that's why I leave it like this:
reviews.title: Comfortable and enjoyable stay

reviews.text: My husband, myself, and our 10 year old stayed here for four nights. I found the hotel on the forum. We were happy with our stay. The staff were very friendly, especially the doormen. They remembered us each day and would briefly chat. This was a sightseeing trip and the hotel is centrally located. The rooms are clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After looking up a gazillion places, I settled with this Marriott. I arrived in DC from Boston at 8, and I was checked into my hotel right away. I usually always ask for early check in, and with no problem it was given. I took the metro everywhere as it was literary outside the door. As it was my first time in DC I wanted to explore the city by foot (also took a taxi here & there) my room was spacious, comfortable, clean and overall kept together. I mainly booked this location for the pool to go for a swim here and there, but I was so buy didn't get a chance to enjoy it until I checked out the pool. I was disappointed as it needs to be updated, and what seems to be years of dirt on the ground.. besides that all in all I was happy!
reviews.title: wonderful location & stay
Great location!
reviews.text: The Location was important as I wanted to travel by foot for the majority of our 3 day stay.The hotel was situated in a perfect area that totally allowed for this! The staff was very friendly and helpful! I would and probably will stay again. It was cleans and quiet as well!

This is your standard Marriott property, which is to say it's clean and comfortable. The staff was super friendly. What makes this hotel stand out is the convenience to the Metro, which is 50 feet down the block from the front entrance. That is, if you need to use it; the hotel is close to many restaurants and night life.
reviews.title: Average Hotel, Great Locatoin
Modern, but a bit stiff.
reviews.text: Service adequate, not exactly warm, and room service food quality not as good as other area hotels for similar or even lower price. But newish facilities and great location keep this on the top 5 list for central DC hotels.

This is a very good hotel right in the middle of everything. As many others have mentioned in their reviews, the hotel is easy walking distance to many places and is practically on top of Metro station, so you can easily get anywhere you like. If you are coming from Regan National, the blue line serves both the airport and Metro station, so it couldn't be easier.
reviews.title: Location location location

reviews.text: The hotel itself is also very nice. Extra-comfortable beds, nice linens, rooms are well-decorated, good work-spaces, etc.
reviews.title: Convenient location, good service.

reviews.text: My only issues were: the nickel and diming that you see at this level of hotel (expensive internet, expensive bottles of water, etc.) and the small club level lounge. I had a reservation that allowed access to the club level lounge for breakfast and coffee and also snacks in the afternoon/evening. Of the 3 mornings that I was at the hotel, I was only able to use the club lounge at breakfast 1 time - the other mornings, it was too crowded for me to even get in. In a hotel this size, the room should be larger. Otherwise this amenity really isn't an amenity at all.
reviews.title: Very full service

reviews.text: I stayed here for 5 nights for a meeting. It is very close to the National Mall, only 2-3 blocks away. I did not need to use the Metro.
reviews.title: Mediocre Thanksgiving Stay

reviews.text: There is a Macy's opposite the Hotel, and on the same street towards the National Mall there is a Barns and Nobles where you can buy toys for the kids.
reviews.title: Good
Wonderful experience!
reviews.text: I came for a big softball tournament this past August. The rooms are really nice, staff was courteous and centrally located, so walking to everything was a breeze. Needless to say, the metro was just outside the front door.

Beautifully decorated, spacious room, and to top it all off, easy access to everything. Walking distance to bars, restaurants, museums, bike stations, etc.They also have a Starbucks downstairs which have friendly baristas. The room has a great view also.
reviews.title: Functional

reviews.text: Their employees were sweet and always greeted us every time we were coming back or leaving they always were friendly.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The only negative is that when expecting really large sports groups, plan for extra valet to minimize congestion & accidents.
reviews.title: Convenient and Consistent

reviews.text: As a hotel where you have a good night's sleep and wake up refreshed then it is a good place to stay. It also has a fantastic gym with steam room: lots of machines and weights with free and clean headphones. It is also perfectly located next to Metro Center metro station. However I'm not sure who the hotel is aimed at. There is only free wifi in the lobby which is a pain if you want to work in your room (unless of course you want to pay for it), There are not many facilities in the room like a fridge or a chair/sofa. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. The same could not be said for the porter in the lobby who we asked to look after our bags whilst we did some shopping (after we had checked out): he was grumpy, slow and then gave a nasty look when we didn't tip him - I always thought gratuities are discretionary and for good service and not necessarily a given.
reviews.title: Ideal for business

aka: Washington Marriott At Metro Hotel Washington Dc
description: Washington Marriott at Metro Center offers convenient access to the best of the capital area. Guests of our hotel will find it a breeze to visit the National Mall, Smithsonian Museums and a variety of other attractions especially with our location above the main hub for the Metro system. Located within blocks of the Verizon Center and the Washington, DC Convention Center, our hotel offers stylish surroundings for guests in town attending conferences, sporting events or concerts. Our hotel's central location, newly renovated guest rooms and dining options including a Starbucks Cafe also make us a great choice for business travelers or those looking for a weekend getaway. With easy access to the region's major airports, the Amtrak station, and the Convention Center, our downtown DC Metro Center hotel is the perfect choice for your next visit to the city, no matter what brings you to town.
